intro: Sinocarum cruciatum var. linearilobum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed crosswort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that resemble those of other members of the carrot family. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae group. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
